exception as follows:
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid image
    at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2180)
    at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2110)
    at
org.eclipse.swt.internal.image.JPEGFileFormat.processRestartInterval(JPEGFileFormat.java:1602)
    at
org.eclipse.swt.internal.image.JPEGFileFormat.decodeScan(JPEGFileFormat.java:734)
    at

    at org.eclipse.swt.internal.image.FileFormat.load(FileFormat.java:71)
    at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.ImageLoader.load(ImageLoader.java:120)

The image loads fine with other applications and with Suns ImageIO.

*** Bug 153034 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Note that the png loading problem (from comment 9/comment 10) is fixed in the 3.3 stream.  However this is not the problem that this report originally described (jpg).

I googled "Casio QV R4 camera" and found a review containing a couple of example photos. I downloaded the jpegs, and one of them doesn't work. So I am going to assume that this image has the same problem as yours. For my own notes, the image is called 'nightshot.jpg' and it is in my 'broken images' directory.
For info, SWT reads this image correctly if you use the native image-loading constructor:  new Image(display, filename)

Fixed > 20060817.

nightshot.jpg can be loaded in latest SWT JPEG loading code. Please the latest.
